main event: On October 31, 1957, in Kanopolis, Kansas, a civilian observed a round object, silver in color, the size of a softball, moving very slowly and very low, on a steady southeast course for 0.30 minutes. The object was initially observed as a round and silver object, moving at a very slow and low altitude. It was suspected to be a balloon, possibly of astronomical origin, with insufficient data for evaluation and an unknown conclusion.
interesting points: The observation lasted for a short duration of 0.30 minutes.
The object was described as very slow and very low, moving with the wind before it was gradually identified as a balloon.
Despite the visual observation, there was no radar contact, and no sight of the object was reported by fighters vectored to its estimated location.
The observer was a civilian, specifically identified as a housewife from Kanopolis, Kansas.
There was no mention of weather interference or optical aids used in the observation.
sighted object: Round silver object, initially suspected to be a balloon
witnesses: Civilian, Mrs. ____________, identified as a housewife
